item.title: UK scientists speak about Brexit pain - BBC News
item.description:
UK scientists speak about Brexit pain - BBC News

Just weeks after the UK voted to leave the European Union, researchers are losing grants. BBC News has spoken to several research groups and small businesses who say they will soon have to scale down operations and lay off staff.

item.title: London's Best Secret Gardens
item.description:
London's Best Secret Gardens

Arts and Lifestyle THE sun has (finally) got its hat on, so it's time to make the most of the long-awaited British summer. Browse Vogue's pick of the 13 best secret gardens in London off the beaten track to while away a sunny day or a dusky evening in the capital.

item.title: Liberals, celebrities and EU supporters set up progressive movement
item.description:
Liberals, celebrities and EU supporters set up progressive movement

A new cross-party movement for progressive liberalism that could endorse candidates in favour of the EU and immigration at the next election is being set up by politicians, celebrities and intellectuals. The initiative has the support of Jonathon Porritt, the environmentalist, Caroline Criado-Perez, the feminist writer and Luke Pritchard from the band Kooks, as a space for people who want a voice for openness and tolerance.

item.title: Here's a fucking twat!
item.description:
Here's a fucking twat!

A UKIP councillor who said on social media that all Remain voters should be killed has apologised and said his comments were a joke. Terence Nathan, a councillor in Bromley, south-east London, posted on Facebook it was "time to start killing these people". He wrote: "There is no need for threats just a bullet".

item.title: Hmm?
item.description:
Hmm?

A new cross-party movement for progressive liberalism that could endorse candidates in favour of the EU and immigration at the next election is being set up by politicians, celebrities and intellectuals. The initiative has the support of Jonathon Porritt, the environmentalist, Caroline Criado-Perez, the feminist writer and Luke Pritchard from the band Kooks, as a space for people who want a voice for openness and tolerance.

item.title: Jesus and Mo
item.description:
Jesus and Mo

Religious satire from holy roomies Jesus & Mohammed in a weekly comic strip.

item.title: Scientists just launched fungi from the radioactive wasteland of Chernobyl into space, and it could change the way we treat cancer
item.description:
Scientists just launched fungi from the radioactive wasteland of Chernobyl into space, and it could change the way we treat cancer

NASA/JPL/Caltech On Monday, eight species of fungi gathered from Chernobyl, the site of the world's worst nuclear disaster, traveled to the International Space Station (ISS) aboard a SpaceX rocket. Scientists hope to understand how the Chernobyl fungi shield themselves from radiation.

item.title: Brexit throws 'spanner in the works' of global growth - BBC News
item.description:
Brexit throws 'spanner in the works' of global growth - BBC News

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said the UK's decision to leave the European Union has "thrown a spanner in the works" of its global growth forecast. Instead of predicting 3.2% growth in 2016, the IMF's World Economic Outlook (WEO) now expects only 3.1%.

item.title: Boris wrong to claim Brexit won't affect our European leadership
item.description:
Boris wrong to claim Brexit won't affect our European leadership

Entering his first EU meeting as Foreign Minister yesterday, Boris Johnson was upbeat about the implications of Brexit on UK foreign policy influence, telling reporters the UK was " not going to be in any way abandoning our leading role in European cooperation and participation of all kinds".
